title: 108_s731
content: The "Secure Authentication Feature and Enhanced Identification Defense Act of 2003" or "SAFE ID Act" is the short title of the legislation. It also addresses fraud and false statements. The "Secure Authentication Feature and Enhanced Identification Defense Act of 2003" or "SAFE ID Act" amends Section 1028(a) of title 18, United States Code by inserting authentication features in various paragraphs related to identification documents. The "SAFE ID Act" amends Section 1028(a) of title 18, United States Code by inserting authentication features in various paragraphs related to identification documents and trafficking in false authentication features. The "SAFE ID Act" amends Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code by inserting authentication features in paragraphs related to identification documents and false authentication features. This includes adding authentication features before "or false" and after "document" in certain clauses, as well as inserting authentication features before "or a false" in paragraph (2)(A). Additionally, Section 1028(c)(1) is amended to include "authentication feature" before "or false" in various instances, and Section 1028(d) is amended to redesignate paragraphs and include authentication features. The "SAFE ID Act" introduces definitions for authentication features and false authentication features in Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code. It includes adding authentication features to identify counterfeit documents and inserting definitions for false authentication features. The "SAFE ID Act" defines false authentication features as genuine features that have been tampered with for deceitful purposes, distributed without authorization, or appear genuine but are not. An issuing authority is a governmental entity or agency. The "SAFE ID Act" defines false authentication features as genuine features that have been tampered with for deceitful purposes, distributed without authorization, or appear genuine but are not. An issuing authority is a governmental entity or agency authorized to issue identification documents, means of identification, or authentication features, including the United States Government, State, political subdivisions, foreign governments, international organizations. The term 'traffic' means to transport, transfer, or dispose of something to another for value. The "SAFE ID Act" defines false authentication features as genuine features that have been tampered with for deceitful purposes, distributed without authorization, or appear genuine but are not. An issuing authority is a governmental entity authorized to issue identification documents, means of identification, or authentication features. The term 'traffic' means to transport, transfer, or dispose of something to another for value. Section 1028 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include additional penalties for forfeiture and destruction of illicit authentication features, identification documents, document-making implements, or means of identification upon conviction of a violation. The United States Code is amended to include "authentication features" in the heading after "documents".
